fields.description: Predictive maintenance techniques are designed to help determine the condition of in-service equipment in order to estimate when maintenance should be performed. This approach promises cost savings over routine or time-based preventive maintenance, because tasks are performed only when warranted. Thus, it is regarded as condition-based maintenance carried out as suggested by estimations of the degradation state of an item. (Wikipedia)
fields.customfield_13513: Evaluation use cases and search for test data to create a ml/ai model.

fields.description: Vault secures, stores, and tightly controls access to tokens, passwords, certificates, API keys, and other secrets in modern computing.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it in customer projects to encrypt data.

fields.description:
Kubernetes key management services (KMS) are used to support encrypting secrets in k8s.

[Explanation on how to configure a Key Management Service (KMS) provider and plugin to enable secret data encryption.|https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/kms-provider/]

 [Information on how to manage encryption keys on Google Cloud Platform|https://cloud.google.com/kms/?hl=de]
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluated products like Hashicorp Vault KMS, Google Cloud KMS, AWS KMS, and Azure Key Vault for Kubernetes KMS.

fields.description: [Kamus|https://kamus.soluto.io/] is an open source, GitOps, zero-trust secrets encryption and decryption solution for Kubernetes applications. Kamus enable users to easily encrypt secrets than can be decrypted only by the application running on Kubernetes. The encryption is done using strong encryption providers (currently supported: Azure KeyVault, Google Cloud KMS, Amazon Web Services KMS and AES).
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluate how to use Kamus to store secrets in k8s.

fields.description: Helm is the package manager for Kubernetes. One downside is the fact that you can’t effectively manage your secrets. Helm Secrets is a plugin you can install on top of Helm to allow the encryption and decryption of secret values.
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluated on how to use Helm Secrets to store secrets in k8s.

fields.description: Sealed Secrets are a "one-way" encrypted Secret that can be created by anyone, but can only be decrypted by the controller running in the target cluster. The Sealed Secret is safe to share publicly, upload to git repositories, post to twitter, etc. Once the SealedSecret is safely uploaded to the target Kubernetes cluster, the sealed secrets controller will decrypt it and recover the original Secret.
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluated how to use this tool to store secrets in k8s.

fields.description: Threat modeling is a procedure for optimizing network security by identifying objectives and vulnerabilities, and then defining countermeasures to prevent, or mitigate the effects of, threats to the system. ... The key to threat modeling is to determine where the most effort should be applied to keep a system secure.
fields.customfield_13513: We use ist to find security requirements for customer projects and to do security analysis of customer projects.

fields.description: A capacity that enables people to focus on what they experience in the moment, internally as well as in their environment, with an attitude of openness, curiosity and care.

Blender is a free and open-source 3D computer graphics software toolset used for creating animated films, visual effects, art, 3D printed models, interactive 3D applications and video games. Blender's features include 3D modeling, UV unwrapping, texturing, raster graphics editing, rigging and skinning, fluid and smoke simulation, particle simulation, soft body simulation, sculpting, animating, match moving, rendering, motion graphics, video editing and compositing. (Source: Wikipedia)
fields.customfield_13513: We create 3D models for our AR/MR applications.

fields.description: [React Native|https://facebook.github.io/react-native/] is an open-source mobile application framework created by Facebook. It is used to develop applications for Android, iOS, Web and UWP by enabling developers to use React along with native platform capabilities.
fields.customfield_13513: We use React Native for developing mobile applicaitions for iOS and Android.

fields.description: In computing, [reactive programming|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reactive_programming] is a declarative programming paradigm concerned with data streams and the propagation of change. With this paradigm it is possible to express static (e.g., arrays) or dynamic (e.g., event emitters) data streams with ease, and also communicate that an inferred dependency within the associated execution model exists, which facilitates the automatic propagation of the changed data flow.
fields.customfield_13513: We use reactive programming in our projects.

fields.description: A [Context-Aware System|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Context_awareness] (CAS) is a system that can understand the context of a given situation and share this context with other systems for their response or respond by itself.
fields.customfield_13513: We observe context awareness as an enabling technology for ubiquitous computing systems. Context awareness is used to design innovative user interfaces.

fields.description: SDS manages data storage resources and functionality without having dependencies on the underlying physical storage hardware. Unlike SAN and NAS systems, SDS products enable users to upgrade the software separately from the hardware.
fields.customfield_13513: We use this approach when storage resources must be easily automated and orchestrated.

fields.description: An in-memory database (IMDB, also main memory database system or MMDB or memory resident database) is a database management system that primarily relies on main memory for computer data storage. It is contrasted with database management systems that employ a disk storage mechanism.
fields.customfield_13513: We use in-memory databases where response times are an important nonfunctional requirement.

fields.description: As name suggests, it consumes lesser amount of power as compared to standard Bluetooth device. Typically battery lasts for 4 to 5 years for applications running on Bluetooth LE's. It is vital for applications that only need to exchange small amounts of data periodically.

Q# (Q-sharp) is a domain-specific programming language driven by Microsoft used for expressing quantum algorithms. It is to be used for writing subroutine that execute on an adjunct quantum processor, under the control of a classical host program and computer. Until quantum processors are widely available, Q# subroutines execute on a simulator.

[|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/quantum/language/?view=qsharp-preview]
fields.customfield_13513: Q# (pronounced as Q sharp) is a domain-specific programming language that is used as an expressing quantum algorithms. Although it was initially released to the public by Microsoft as part of the Quantum Development Kit.

fields.description: [Jepsen|https://github.com/jepsen-io/jepsen] is a Clojure library. A test is a Clojure program which uses the Jepsen library to set up a distributed system, run a bunch of operations against that system, and verify that the history of those operations makes sense. Jepsen has been used to verify everything from eventually-consistent commutative databases to linearizable coordination systems to distributed task schedulers. It can also generate graphs of performance and availability, helping you characterize how a system responds to different faults. See [jepsen.io|https://jepsen.io/analyses] for examples of the sorts of analyses you can carry out with Jepsen.
fields.customfield_13513: Setting up distributed systems.

fields.description: Based on Ethereum, [Quorum|https://www.goquorum.com/] is used as an open source blockchain platform that combines the innovation of the public Ethereum community with enhancements to support the enterprise needs. The goal is to make adopting blockchain a seamless process.
[Knative|https://knative.dev/] is used as a platform to build, deploy, run and manage modern "serverless" workloads based on Kubernetes.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Knative for serverless workloads.

fields.description: [Istio|https://istio.io/] is an open platform for providing a uniform way to integrate microservices, manage traffic flow across microservices, enforce policies and aggregate telemetry data. Istio's control plane provides an abstraction layer over the underlying cluster management platform, such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Istio to integrate microservices.

fields.description: [CockroachDB|https://github.com/cockroachdb] is used as an architected for the cloud that delivers resilient, consistent, distributed SQL at a desired scale.
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluated Cockroach as a database that tolerates system-failures with minimal latency disruption and no manual intervention.

fields.description: [kube-bench|https://github.com/aquasecurity/kube-bench] is an example of an [infrastructure configuration scanner|https://www.thoughtworks.com/radar/techniques/infrastructure-configuration-scanner] that automates checking your Kubernetes configuration against the [CIS benchmark for K8s|https://www.cisecurity.org/benchmark/kubernetes/]. It covers user authentication, permissions and secure data among other areas. Our teams have found kube-bench valuable in the identification of vulnerable configurations.
fields.customfield_13513: Checking our cloud managed Kubernetes clusters against CIS benchmark for secure configuration

fields.description: [Grafeas|https://grafeas.io/] is used as an open-source artifact metadata API that provides a uniform way to audit and govern your software supply chain.
fields.customfield_13513: We see Grafeas as a tool to trace the compliance of security best practices across an organization.

fields.description:
[Snyk|https://snyk.io/] is a commercial service that focuses on JavaScript npm dependencies. New to the scene, Snyk is in a league of its own. Not only does it offer tools to detect known vulnerabilities in JavaScript projects, but it also helps users fix these issues using guided upgrades and open-source patches that Snyk creates.

Snyk has its own vulnerability database, which gets its data from the NIST NVD and the NSP. Snyk's focus is on scaling known vulnerability handling across the entire organization and its teams, with better collaboration tools and tighter GitHub integrations. Snyk's CEO, Guy Podjarny, indicated that Snyk's future plans include building runtime tools that will give developers better visibility and control when running open-source packages on production systems.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Snyk for finding & fixing vulnerabilities in JavaScript projects.

fields.description:
[Archery|https://archerysec.com/] is an open-source vulnerability assessment and management tool which helps developers and pentesters to perform security-scans and manage vulnerabilities.
Designed primarily for web applications, Archery makes it easy to integrate security tooling into your build and deployment systems. Its dashboards also let you track vulnerabilities as well as application and network scans.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to perform security scans and manage vulnerabilities.

fields.description:
[PostgreSQL|https://www.postgresql.org/], also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) emphasizing extensibility and technical standards compliance. It is designed to handle a range of workloads, from single machines to data warehouses or Web services with many concurrent users.

Its development began in the 1980s, and since 1997 the software has been further developed by an open source community.
fields.customfield_13513: We use PostgreSQL as a general-purpose object-relational database management system in many of our projects.

fields.description: Blazor is used to build interactive web UIs using C# instead of JavaScript. Both client and server code are written in C Sharp.

Azure Service Fabric is a distributed systems platform that makes it easy to package, deploy, and manage scalable and reliable microservices and containers. Service Fabric also addresses the significant challenges in developing and managing cloud native applications. Developers and administrators can avoid complex infrastructure problems and focus on implementing mission-critical, demanding workloads that are scalable, reliable, and manageable. Service Fabric represents the next-generation platform for building and managing these enterprise-class, tier-1, cloud-scale applications running in containers.

[https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-overview]
fields.customfield_13513: A Service Fabric is used as a microservices platform that gives every micro service a unique name that can be either stateless or state full. Furthermore, it provides comprehensive runtime and lifecycle management capabilities to applications that are composed of these microservices.

fields.description:
SharePoint Online is a cloud-based service that helps organizations share and manage content, knowledge, and applications to:
 Empower teamwork
 Quickly find information
 Seamlessly collaborate across the organization
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to exchange knowledge.

fields.description: Testing and validating REST services in Java is harder than in dynamic languages such as Ruby and Groovy. REST Assured brings the simplicity of using these languages into the Java domain.
fields.customfield_13513:
End2End Tests via (HTTP) APIs
Integration Tests of (HTTP) API modules

fields.description: Protocol Buffers (Protobuf) is a method of serializing structured data. It is useful in developing programs to communicate with each other over a wire or for storing data. The method involves an interface description language that describes the structure of some data and a program that generates source code from that description for generating or parsing a stream of bytes that represents the structured data.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Protobuf as alternative for JSON.

fields.description: [Velero|https://velero.io/] (formerly Heptio Ark) is an open source software to easily manage backups and restores of a whole Kubernetes cluster. That includes resource definitions and also persistent volumes.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for managing disaster recovery for Kubernetes clusters.

fields.description: Connecting industrial processes with sensors and collect/analyze the data.
fields.customfield_13513: We design unique solutions for manufacturing industry considering security, data analytics and infrastructure challenges.

fields.description:
The [OpenAPI Specification|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenAPI_Specification], originally known as the Swagger Specification, is a specification for machine-readable interface files for describing, producing, consuming, and visualizing RESTful web services. Originally part of the Swagger framework, it became a separate project in 2016, overseen by the OpenAPI Initiative, an open-source collaboration project of the Linux Foundation. Swagger and some other tools can generate code, documentation and test cases given an interface file.

List of known [tooling that implements|https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/IMPLEMENTATIONS.md#implementations] OpenAPI specification.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Swagger to keep the documentation, client libraries, and source code in sync.

fields.description: The goal of In-Memory Data Grids (IMDG) is to provide extremely high availability of data by keeping it in memory and in highly distributed (i.e. parallelized) fashion. By loading Terabytes of data into memory IMDGs are able to work with most of the Big Data processing requirements today.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for processing of Big Data

fields.description:
[AWS Auto Scaling|https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/] is a service that automatically monitors and adjusts compute resources to maintain performance for applications hosted in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) public cloud.

AWS Auto Scaling helps to ensure that the correct number of Amazon instances are available to handle the load for an application. To do this, collections of compute-instances, called Auto Scaling groups, are created. By specifying scaling policies, AWS Auto Scaling can launch or terminate instances as demand on an application increases or decreases.
fields.customfield_13513: We use AWS Auto Scaling in our customer projects that run on AWS.

fields.description: [Ant|https://ant.apache.org/] is a programming tool which is used to build a new version of a program. Ant (an acronym for Another Neat Tool) is an XML based build tool. It is a widely used Java-based build tool with the full portability of the pure Java code. Apache ANT helps you to convert source code into executable code.
fields.customfield_13513: Belongs to our daily work and as a tool it is still in use. But is clearly on the retreat compared to for example Gradle.

fields.description: RabbitMQ is a popular open source message broker.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as message broker tool. For future deployment, we do not need specific observation/evaluation as it is lightweight and easy for deployment from a developers perspective.

fields.description: The Pact family of frameworks provide support for Consumer Driven Contracts testing.
fields.customfield_13513: Pact is used as a code-first tool for testing HTTP and message integrations using contract tests. Contract tests assert that inter-application messages conform to a shared understanding that is truly documented in a contract.

fields.description: [Helm|https://helm.sh/] helps to manage Kubernetes applications. Helm Charts help to define, install, and upgrade even the most complex Kubernetes application.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to make application deployment easy, standardized and reusable.

fields.description: [Gradle|https://gradle.org/] is a groovy-based open-source build management automation tool that operates with a Groovy-based domain-specific language (DSL) to describe to be build projects. Gradle supports both incremental and parallel build processes for a faster implementation.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Gradle in many of our projects.

fields.description: A free software based on Apache 2.0 license that allows the visualization and formatting of metric data. It allows for the creation of dashboards and graphs from multiple sources, including time series databases such as Graphite, InfluxDB and OpenTSDB.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for metric analytics and visualization.

fields.description: Syntactically awesome style sheets (SASS) is a style sheet language, which is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).
fields.customfield_13513: We use SASS as alternative to CSS.

fields.description: Oracle Forms is a software product for creating screens that interact with an Oracle database
fields.customfield_13513: Creating Forms for legacy Oracle Databases

fields.description: jQuery is a open source JavaScript library which is desgined to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation. It is a very popular library and is used by 73% of the 10 million most popular websites.
fields.customfield_13513: We use jQuery in our web projects to build interactive websites.

fields.description: The [Secure Production Identity Framework for Everyone|https://spiffe.io/] (SPIFFE), is a set of open-source standards for securely identifying software systems in dynamic and heterogeneous environments. Systems that adopt SPIFFE can easily and reliably mutually authenticate wherever they are running.
fields.customfield_13513: We observe SPIFFE and tools that implement this framework for the usage in dynamic and heterogeneous cloud production environments.

fields.description:
[Debezium|https://debezium.io/] is an open source distributed platform for change data capture. Pointed at a database, apps can start responding to all of the inserts, updates, and deletes that other apps commit to that databases.

Debezium let apps react every time data changes, without changing the apps that modify the data. Debezium continuously monitors databases and let applications stream every row-level change in the same order they were committed to the database.

[Apache Atlas|https://atlas.apache.org/] is the one stop solution for data governance and metadata management on enterprise Hadoop clusters. Atlas has a scalable and extensible architecture which can plug into many Hadoop components to manage their metadata in a central repository.
fields.customfield_13513: Used for metadata management and it's governance capabilities.

fields.description:
[Jaeger|https://www.jaegertracing.io/] is a distributed tracing system released as open source by Uber Technologies. It can be used for monitoring microservices-based distributed systems. 
Use cases are distributed context propagation, distributed transaction monitoring, root cuase analysis and performance/latency optimization.

[Codefresh|https://codefresh.io/] is a Docker-native CI/CD platform for Kubernetes. It can be used to instantly build, test and deploy Docker images. Codefresh has an advanced distributed caching that caches images, layers, source code, dependencies, and more - and they’re distributed across all nodes used in any pipeline. 

It is potentially interesting for customers with unmanaged Kubernetes clusters. Expensive.

[Data-as-a-Service (DaaS)|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_as_a_service] is an open source software solution or cloud service that provides critical capabilities for a wide range of data sources for analytical workloads through a unified set of APIs and data model. DaaS builds on the concept that its data product can be provided to the user on demand, regardless of geographic or organizational separation between provider and consumer.

Amazon Aurora is a relational database service that combines the speed and availability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open source databases. The PostgreSQL-compatible edition of Aurora delivers up to 3X the throughput of standard PostgreSQL running on the same hardware, enabling existing PostgreSQL applications and tools to run without requiring modification. The combination of PostgreSQL compatibility with Aurora enterprise database capabilities provides an ideal target for commercial database migrations.

fields.summary: Microsoft SQL Server 2017 Machine Learning Services
fields.description:
[Machine Learning Services|https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/sql/advanced-analytics/?view=sql-server-ver15] integrates R and Python with SQL Server, making it easy to build, retrain, and score models by calling stored procedures.

Machine Learning Services is a feature in SQL Server that provides the ability to execute Python and R scripts with relational data. You can use open source packages and frameworks and the Microsoft Python and R packages for predictive analytics and machine learning. The scripts run in the database without moving data from SQL Server or across the network.
fields.customfield_13513: Observe

fields.description: [Power BI|https://powerbi.microsoft.com/] is a business analytics service by Microsoft. It aims to provide interactive visualizations and business intelligence capabilities with an interface simple enough for end users to create their own reports and dashboards.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as a business analytics service.

fields.description: [Galen Framework|http://galenframework.com/] is a test framework which was originally introduced for testing layout of web-applications in a real browser. Nowadays it became a fully functional testing framework with rich reporting and test management system. It supports both JavaScript and Java tests.
fields.customfield_13513: Automated testing of responsive design

fields.description: Invision is a tool for creating UI prototypes and wireframes.
fields.customfield_13513: Used to  quickly and easily create interactive mockups for our designs.

fields.description:
[Datadog|https://www.datadoghq.com/product/] is used as a monitoring service for cloud-scale applications, providing monitoring of servers, databases, tools, and services, through a SaaS-based data analytics platform.

Datadog helps developers and operations teams see their full infrastructure – cloud, servers, apps, services, metrics, and more – all in one place. This includes real-time interactive dashboards that can be customized to a team's specific needs, full-text search capabilities for metrics and events, sharing and discussion tools so teams can collaborate using the insights they surface, targeted alerts for critical issues, and API access to accommodate unique infrastructures.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Datadog as a monitoring service for cloud-scale applications.

fields.description: Puppeteer offers a high-level API which provide headless control for Chrome or Chromium over the DevTool Protocol. It can also be configured to use full (non-headless) Chrome or Chromium.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as a Node library which provides a high-level API to control Chrome or Chromium over the DevTools Protocol.

fields.description:
Used to declare cloud infrastructure using real languages. Enable developers and operators to work better together. 
Multilingual development platform for multi-cloud applications. Users should be able to create all aspects of cloud programs with code, from the infrastructure to the application itself.

Bitrise is a Continous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) Platform as a Service (PaaS) with a main focus on mobile app development (iOS, Android). This tool offers automate testing and deployment with a few clicks.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as a collection of tools and services to help you with the development and automation of your software projects.

fields.description: [File analysis software|https://www.gartner.com/doc/3869701/market-guide-file-analysis-software] scans, maps and manages unstructured data stores. This thus enables data and analytics leaders to make better data management decisions for unstructured data, which in turn reduces risk and lowers costs associated with data.

[Aurelia|https://aurelia.io/] is a modern front-end framework for building browser, mobile and desktop applications. Aurelia is Open Source Software.

Rather than being a monolithic framework, Aurelia is broken down into a collection of feature-oriented modules. Examples of feature modules include metadata, dependency injection, binding, templating, router and more. Each module is written using ECMAScript (aka JavaScript) or TypeScript (a strict superset of JavaScript that adds compile-time type checking). Many of these modules can be used individually in any type of JavaScript project, including Node.js.
fields.customfield_13513: Framework is used in frontend development.

fields.description: [Anypoint Platform|https://www.mulesoft.com/platform/enterprise-integration] is a complete solution for API-led connectivity that helps companies build application networks of apps, data, and devices, both on-premises and in the cloud. This hybrid integration platform includes iPaaS, ESB, and a unified solution for API management, design and publishing.

[PostCSS|https://postcss.org/] is a tool for transforming CSS with JavaScript. It provides a CSS parser and a framework for creating plugins that can analyse, lint, handle assets, optimise, create fallbacks, and otherwise transform parsed CSS. PostCSS parses CSS into an abstract syntax tree (AST), passes it through a series of plugins, and then concatenates back into a string.
fields.customfield_13513: Tool that we use for formatting CSS.

fields.description: Babel is a JavaScript compiler which is used to convert ECMAScript 2015+ code into a backwards compatible version of JavaScript in current and older browsers or environments.
fields.customfield_13513: Used to convert ECMAScript 2015+ code into a backwards compatible version of JavaScript in current and older browsers or environments.

fields.description: Amazon SageMaker is a cloud machine-learning platform. SageMaker enables developers to create, train, and deploy machine-learning and to deploy machine-learning (ML) models on embedded systems and edge-devices.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for machine learning applications.

fields.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript [Library] that executes JavaScript code outside of a browser
fields.customfield_13513: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a browser. To simplify the development of web applications node.js provides a rich libary of various JavaScript modules.

fields.description: [Puppet|https://puppet.com/] provides the tools to separate entire branches of configurations (called environments). A [Puppet environment|https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/6.10/environments_about.html] is a way to supply an isolated group of agent nodes with their own dedicated configuration. Each environment contains an entire Puppet configuration tree and can be considered as a separate Puppet master server.

[Integration platform as a service (iPaaS)|https://searchcloudcomputing.techtarget.com/definition/iPaaS-integration-platform-as-a-service] is a set of automated tools for connecting software applications that are deployed in different environments. iPaaS is often used by large business-to-business (B2B) enterprises that need to integrate on-premises applications and data with cloud applications and data.
Public PaaS solutions are platforms that run on the public cloud.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for application development.

fields.description: Using the capabilities of public cloud storage.
fields.customfield_13513: We are using the capabilities of public cloud storage.

fields.description:
Techopedia explains Cloud Storage Gateway
A cloud storage gateway is designed to provide interoperability between different data protocols used in a client/server cloud architecture. It allows interoperability between the application programming interface (API) of a client's REST/SOAP-based data storage and Internet SCSI (iSCSI), Fiber Channel (FC) and other cloud storage server system protocols.

Generally, cloud storage gateways are implemented as software gateways that provide a suite of services to facilitate seamless data transfer and retrieval between remote cloud storage servers, data compression for faster transfer, version management and control of entire storage snapshots and run-time encryption, which ensures secure data transmission.
fields.customfield_13513: Cloud storage gateways are used as physical/virtual appliances or installable software that is located in an organization's enterprise data center or public cloud network that provide users and applications seamless access to data stored in a public or private cloud.

fields.description:
Blameless Post Mortem is a process in that a professional whose actions have contributed to an accident can give a detailed account of:
 * what actions they took at what time
 * what they observed
 * expectations they had
 * assumptions they had made
 * and their understanding of timeline of events as they occured.

The important aspect is that the professional can give this account without fear of punishment or retribution.
fields.customfield_13513: We implement Blameless Post Mortem as a process.

fields.description: [Chaos Katas|https://www.thoughtworks.com/de/radar/techniques/chaos-katas] is a technique that [ThougtWorks|https://www.thoughtworks.com/] has developed to train and upskill infrastructure and platform engineers. It combines Chaos Engineering techniques - that is, creating failures and outages in a controlled environment - with the systematic teaching and training approach of Kata. Here, Kata refers to code patterns that trigger controlled failures, allowing engineers to discover the problem, recover from the failure, run postmortem and find the root cause. Repeated execution of Katas helps engineers to internalize their new skills.

[Deep reinforcement learning|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_reinforcement_learning] (DRL) uses deep learning and reinforcement learning principles in order to create efficient algorithms. Implementing deep learning architecture (deep neural networks or etc.) with reinforcement learning algorithms (Q-learning, actor critic or etc.), a powerful model (DRL) can be created that is capable to scale to previously unsolvable problems. That is because DRL usually uses raw sensor or image signals as input and can receive the benefit of end-to-end reinforcement learning as well as that of convolutional neural networks.

An introduction to DRL can be found [here|https://arxiv.org/abs/1811.12560].
fields.customfield_13513: Creating neural networks.

fields.description: Privacy by desgin is an approach to integrate data protection into the development process of an product.
fields.customfield_13513: Build up knowledge on mechanisms to ensure Privacy by design.  Encryption/Hashing/Anonymization

fields.description: [Conversational AI|https://georgianpartners.com/investment-thesis-areas/overview-conversational-ai/] is a form of Artificial Intelligence that allows people to communicate with applications, websites and devices in everyday, humanlike natural language via voice, text, touch or gesture input. For users it allows fast interaction using their own words and terminology.
fields.customfield_13513: Used to automate communication and create personalized customer experiences in apps

fields.description: Evil user stories are just like normal user stories, except they represent what a malevolent user would do in your product instead of what a benign user would do. In every case, these stories represent what you don't want a user doing inside of your product.
fields.customfield_13513: Find and describe security requirements for customer projects.

fields.description: [Python|https://www.python.org/] is an interpreted, object-oriented, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics. Its high-level built in data structures, combined with dynamic typing and dynamic binding, make it very attractive for Rapid Application Development, as well as for use as a scripting or glue language to connect existing components together. Python's simple, easy to learn syntax emphasizes readability and therefore reduces the cost of program maintenance.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Python for creating machine learning applications.

fields.description: RoundhouseE offers a automated database deployment system that solve the maintenance concerns and the ease of deployment.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it in our database deployment.

fields.description: [Gatling|https://gatling.io/] is an open-source load and performance testing framework based on Scala, Akka and Netty. ... The software is designed to be used as a load testing tool for analyzing and measuring the performance of a variety of services, with a focus on web applications.
fields.customfield_13513: Load-Testing, Synthetic Monitoring

fields.description: [Akka Streams|https://doc.akka.io/docs/akka/current/stream/index.html] is a library to process and transfer a sequence of elements using bounded buffer space. This latter property is what we refer to as _boundedness_, and it is the defining feature of Akka Streams. Translated to everyday terms, it is possible to express a chain (or graphs) of processing entities. Each of these entities executes independently (and possibly concurrently) from the others while only buffering a limited number of elements at any given time. This property of bounded buffers is one of the differences from the actor model, where each actor usually has an unbounded, or a bounded, but dropping mailbox. Akka Stream processing entities have bounded “mailboxes” that do not drop.

[TestCafe|https://devexpress.github.io/testcafe/] is a Node.js tool which offers automation of end-to-end web testing.

TestCafe is an engine for driving browsers. It is driven by a technology which provides fast and simple cross browser testing for desktop and mobile browsers. TestCafe core is a proxy server that runs behind the scene, and transforms all HTML and JS to include code that is needed for test automation.
fields.customfield_13513: We use TestCafe for testing

fields.description: [Terragrunt|https://github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt] is a thin wrapper for Terraform that implements the practices advocated by the Terraform: Up and Running book. Terragrunt is helpful as it encourages versioned modules and reusability for different environments with some handy features, including recursive code execution in subdirectories.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for our Terraform configurations.

fields.description:
Play Framework makes it easy to build web applications with Java & Scala.

Play is based on a lightweight, stateless, web-friendly architecture.

Built on Akka, Play provides predictable and minimal resource consumption (CPU, memory, threads) for highly-scalable applications.
fields.customfield_13513: Building web application

fields.description: A hybrid app is used as a combination of a native app and a web app. Although this type of app can be installed on a device like a normal app, it is technically a web app. These types of apps are built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and run in a called webview.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as a combination of a native app and a web app.

fields.description: In-memory analytics is a business intelligence (BI) methodology used to solve complex and time-sensitive business scenarios. It works by increasing the speed, performance and reliability when querying data.
fields.customfield_13513: We use In Memory analytics as method for solving business scenarios.

fields.description: Polly.js is a javascript library for recording, replaying and stubbing of HTTP interactions. It allows to mock requests and responses.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Polly.js for testing our code.

fields.description: Ktor is a framework for building asynchronous servers and clients in connected systems using the powerful Kotlin programming language.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Ktor as Framework for our Kotlin applications.

fields.description: Prettier is an open source framework which is used for formatting code.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as an opinionated code formatter.

fields.description: Big data visualization refers to the implementation of more contemporary visualization techniques to illustrate the relationships within data. Visualization tactics include applications that can display real-time changes and more illustrative graphics, thus going beyond pie, bar and other charts.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to visualize big data.

fields.description: Business-to-Business (B2B) Gateways integrate data from back-end systems enabling information exchange across trading partners. B2B Gateways also provide a centralized point for transformation of multiple data sources through interoperability standards such as XML (Extensible Markup Language), cXML(Commerce XML) and EDI (Electronic data interchange).
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to bridge the collaboration gap across the supply chain partners.

fields.description:
Logging is an essential part of development. While working on React projects, logging provides a way to get feedback and information about what’s happening within the running code. However, once an app or website is deployed into production, the default console provides no way to continue benefiting from logs.

Since these logs are client-side, all errors experienced by users will be lost in their own browsers. This means that the only way we can find out about errors in our application is by user reports, which often don’t happen; many users will simply leave rather than filling out a bug report. Therefore, good user experience relies on errors being reported without user intervention, which is a feature that the default console lacks.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as implementation of logging error´s on the client-side in applications

fields.description: A technique enabling the build package to be independent from the environment it's being deployed to - making it easier to follow the "Build once, deploy often" CI/CD principle
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for deploying applications to an environment

fields.description: Pipeline as Code is a set of features that allows to define pipelined job processes with code, stored and versioned in a source repository.
fields.customfield_13513:
Pipeline as Code wird in unterschiedlichen Produkten und Topics eingesetzt. Im Mobile Apps Kontext werden folgende Tools die dieses Prinzip adaptiert haben eingesetzt.
Fastlane
Jenkins

fields.description:
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is the management of infrastructure (networks, virtual machines, load balancers, and connection topology) in a descriptive model, using the same versioning as DevOps team uses for source code. Like the principle that the same source code generates the same binary, an IaC model generates the same environment every time it is applied. IaC is a key DevOps practice and is used in conjunction with continuous delivery.

[https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/learn/what-is-infrastructure-as-code]
fields.customfield_13513: Used to manage infrastructures (networks, virtual machines, load balancers, and connection topology) in a descriptive model.

fields.description: Redux is an open source JavaScript library which is used for writing app write applications that behave consistently, run in different environments (client, server, and native), and are easy to test.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Redux for JavaScript applications.

fields.description: Social Analytics refers to the collection and analysis of statistical, digital data on how users interface with an organization, particularly online

[Cyber threat intelligence|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyber_threat_intelligence] is information an organization uses to understand the threats that have, will, or are currently targeting the organization. This info is used to prepare, prevent, and identify cyber threats looking to take advantage of valuable resources.

Cloud access security brokers (CASBs) are on-premises, or cloud-based security policy enforcement points, placed between cloud service consumers and cloud service providers to combine and interject enterprise security policies as the cloud-based resources are accessed. CASBs consolidate multiple types of security policy enforcement. Example security policies include authentication, single sign-on, authorization, credential mapping, device profiling, encryption, tokenization, logging, alerting, malware detection/prevention and so on.
fields.customfield_13513: We evaluate it mainly as part of API gateways at our customers and use it as part of trainings/coaching

fields.description: [Embedded analytics|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embedded_analytics] is the integration of analytic content and capabilities within business process applications. It provides relevant information and analytical tools designed so users can work smarter and more efficiently in the applications they use every day.

[Data virtualization|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_virtualization] is any approach to data management that allows an application to retrieve and manipulate data without requiring technical details about the data, such as how it is formatted at source, or where it is physically located, and can provide a single customer view (or single view of any other entity) of the overall data.

Unlike the traditional extract, transform, load ("ETL") process, the data remains in place, and real-time access is given to the source system for the data. This reduces the risk of data errors, of the workload moving data around that may never be used, and it does not attempt to impose a single data model on the data (an example of heterogeneous data is a federated database system). To resolve differences in source and consumer formats and semantics, various abstraction and transformation techniques are used. This concept and software is a subset of data integration and is commonly used within business intelligence, service-oriented architecture data services, cloud computing, enterprise search, and master data management.

The Knowledge Graph is a knowledge base used by Google and its services to enhance its search engine's results with information gathered from a variety of sources. The information is presented to users in an infobox next to the search results.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as a knowledge base to enhance the search engine's results with information gathered from a variety of sources.

fields.description: Style Guide Driven Development is an approach that puts a living style guide at the center of both the design and development process.
fields.customfield_13513: we use it to create a design system that establishes a starting point for designs, evolves with the application, and makes development faster

fields.description: A [distributed ledger|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Distributed_ledger] (also called a shared ledger or distributed ledger technology or DLT) is a consensus of replicated, shared, and synchronized digital data geographically spread across multiple sites, countries, or institutions. There is no central administrator or centralized data storage. A peer-to-peer network is required as well as consensus algorithms to ensure replication across nodes is undertaken.[2] One form of distributed ledger design is the blockchain system, which can be either public or private.

A [digital twin|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_twin] is a digital replica of a living or non-living physical entity. By bridging the physical and the virtual world, data is transmitted seamlessly allowing the virtual entity to exist simultaneously with the physical entity. Digital twin refers to a digital replica of potential and actual physical assets (physical twin), processes, people, places, systems and devices that can be used for various purposes. The digital representation provides both the elements and the dynamics of how an Internet of things device operates and lives throughout its life cycle.

[UI dev environments|https://www.thoughtworks.com/radar/tools/ui-dev-environments] provide a comprehensive environment for quickly iterating on UI components, focusing on collaboration between user experience designers and developers.
fields.customfield_13513: We use UI dev environments to decrease UI feedback cycles.

fields.description: [Secrets as a service|https://www.thoughtworks.com/de/radar/techniques/secrets-as-a-service] uses external identity providers such as AWS IAM to identify the actors who request access to secrets. Actors authenticate themselves with the secrets service. For this process to work, it's important to automate bootstrapping the identity of the actors, services and applications.
fields.customfield_13513: Used to securely store secrets, encryption keys and certificates

fields.description:
[Canary release|https://martinfowler.com/bliki/CanaryRelease.html] is a technique to reduce the risk of introducing a new software version in production by slowly rolling out the change to a small subset of users before rolling it out to the entire infrastructure and making it available to everybody.

Canary release with a very small segment like 1 percent, is called [1% canary|https://www.thoughtworks.com/de/radar/techniques/1-canary].
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to mitigate the risk associated with rolling out new code and functionality.

fields.description: An open source OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth 2.0 framework.
fields.customfield_13513:
- Authentication concepts using identity servers
- OAuth2 / OIDC flows
- SAML assertions

fields.description: Virtual-, Mixed- and Augmented Reality combined in one term. So the extension or replacement of the existing reality
fields.customfield_13513: Developing MR- and AR-apps

fields.description: [Behavior Driven Development (BDD)|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavior-driven_development] is an Agile software development process that encourages collaboration among developers, QA and non-technical or business participants in a software project. It encourages teams to use conversation and concrete examples to formalize a shared understanding of how the application should behave. It emerged from test-driven development (TDD). Behavior-driven development combines the general techniques and principles of TDD with ideas from domain-driven design and object-oriented analysis and design to provide software development and management teams with shared tools and a shared process to collaborate on software development.
fields.customfield_13513: We use BDD for collaboration of business, developers, and testers. Also connection to business agility.

fields.description:
[JUnit 5|https://junit.org/junit5/] is the next generation of JUnit. The goal is to create an up-to-date foundation for developer-side testing on the JVM. This includes focusing on Java 8 and above, as well as enabling many different styles of testing.

NovaTec Resources:
 * [Blog: Better Test Structure with JUnit 5|http://blog.novatec-gmbh.de/better-test-structure-junit-5/]
 * [Blog: Dynamic Tests with JUnit 5|http://blog.novatec-gmbh.de/dynamic-tests-junit-5/]
 * [Blog: JUnit 5 Parameter Resolver|http://blog.novatec-gmbh.de/junit-5-parameter-resolver/]
 * [Blog: Enforcing Non-Functional Test Requirements|http://blog.novatec-gmbh.de/enforcing-non-functional-test-requirements/]
 * [Blog: JUnit 5 Extension Lifecycle|http://blog.novatec-gmbh.de/junit-5-extension-lifecycle/]
fields.customfield_13513: We use JUnit 5 as the basis for most testautomation on the JVM.

fields.description: A [relational database|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relational_database] is a database which is based on the relational model. The approach of the relational model is to represent data in term of tuples, grouped into relations. Many relational database systems have an option of using SQL for quering and maintaining the database.
fields.customfield_13513: We use relational databases in our projects, where the relational model is the best solution.

fields.description: MongoDB Realm is an open source object database management system, initially for mobile (Android/iOS).
fields.customfield_13513: We us Realm as database managment system.

fields.description: IntelliJ is an IDE developed by JetBrains. It supports many languages like Java, Groovy and Kotlin.
fields.customfield_13513: IntelliJ is used for developing applications.

fields.description: [Flutter|https://flutter.dev/] is an open-source mobile SDK developer can use to build native-looking Android and iOS applications from the same code base. Flutter has been around since 2015 when Google introduced it and remained in the beta stage before its official launch in December 2018.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Flutter to build mobile apps.

fields.description: [Fuchsia|https://fuchsia.dev/] is an open source capability-based operating system currently being developed by Google. It first became known to the public when the project appeared on a self hosted form of git in August 2016 without any official announcement. In contrast to prior Google-developed operating systems such as Chrome OS and Android, which are based on the Linux kernel, Fuchsia is based on a new microkernel called Zircon.

[Firebase|https://firebase.google.com/] is a mobile and web application development platform developed by Firebase, Inc. in 2011, then acquired by Google in 2014. As of October 2018, the Firebase platform has 18 products.

Firebase is a technology that allows developers to create web applications without server-side programming, making development faster and easier. It supports Web, iOS, OS X and Android clients. Apps that use Firebase can use and control data without thinking about how data is stored and synchronized across different instances of the application in real-time.
iOS is a mobile operating system developed by Apple. It is primarily used for Apple´s mobile products like iPhone and iPad.
fields.customfield_13513: We develop apps for the OS.

fields.description: [Software craftsmanship|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_craftsmanship] is an approach to software development that emphasizes the coding skills of the software developers. It is a [response|http://manifesto.softwarecraftsmanship.org/] by software developers to the perceived ills of the mainstream software industry, including the prioritization of financial concerns over developer accountability. Not only working software matters, but also well-crafted software.
fields.customfield_13513: We use this approach as our standard and appreciate the values of it.

fields.description:
[TypeScript|http://www.typescriptlang.org/] is an open-source programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript, and adds optional static typing to the language.

TypeScript is designed for development of large applications and transcompiles to JavaScript. As TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript, existing JavaScript programs are also valid TypeScript programs. TypeScript may be used to develop JavaScript applications for both client-side and server-side (Node.js, Deno) execution.
fields.customfield_13513: We use TypeScript for web-development

fields.description: JavaScript is programming language that consforms to the ECMAScript specification. Alongside HTML and CSS, JavaScript is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web.
fields.customfield_13513: JavaScript is primarily used for building websites.

fields.description: React is a JavaScript library for developing single-page or mobile applications. It is maintained by Facebook and a community of individual developers and companies.
fields.customfield_13513: We use React to build user interfaces for our applications.

fields.description:
Javascript library developed and maintained by Facebook for building reactive user interfaces.

[|https://reactjs.org/]
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as Javascript library developed and maintained by Facebook for building reactive user interfaces.

fields.description: "Spring Reactor, Vertx, Netty"
fields.customfield_13513: "Spring Reactor, Vertx, Netty"

fields.description: Web app that uses modern web capabilities to deliver an app-like experience to users.
fields.customfield_13513: Used as a web app that uses modern web capabilities to deliver an app-like experience to users.

fields.description: A [progressive web application|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_web_application] (PWA) is a type of application software delivered through the web, built using common web technologies including HTML, CSS and JavaScript. It is intended to work on any platform that uses a standards-compliant browser. Functionality includes working offline, push notifications, and device hardware access, enabling creating user experiences similar to native applications on desktop and mobile devices. Since progressive web apps are a type of webpage or website known as a web application, there is no requirement for developers or users to install the web apps via digital distribution systems like Apple App Store or Google Play.

[GraphQL|https://graphql.org/] is an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data. It provides an approach to developing web APIs, and has been compared and contrasted with REST and other web service architectures. It allows clients to define the structure of the data required, and the same structure of the data is returned from the server, therefore preventing excessively large amounts of data from being returned. It consists of a type system, query language and execution semantics, static validation, and type introspection. GraphQL supports reading, writing (mutating), and subscribing to changes to data (realtime updates - most commonly implemented using WebHooks).
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as an alternative to REST.

fields.description: [Vue.js|https://vuejs.org/] is an open-source Model–view–viewmodel JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications. Vue.js features an incrementally adoptable architecture that focuses on declarative rendering and component composition. Advanced features required for complex applications such as routing, state management and build tooling are offered via officially maintained supporting libraries and packages, with [Nuxt.js|https://nuxtjs.org/] as one of the most popular solutions.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Vue.js in web development.

fields.description:
[Eclipse MicroProfile|https://microprofile.io/] is an initiative that aims to optimize Enterprise Java for the Microservices architecture. The goal of MicroProfile is to define standard APIs for building microservices and deliver portable applications across multiple MicroProfile runtimes.

A very good explanation of MicroProfile can be found at [Tomitribe|https://www.tomitribe.com/blog/what-is-eclipse-microprofile/].

Runtime application self-protection (RASP) is a security technology that uses runtime instrumentation to detect and block computer attacks by taking advantage of information from inside the running software. The technology differs from perimeter-based protections such as firewalls, that can only detect and block attacks by using network information without contextual awareness.
fields.customfield_13513: We look at frameworks.

fields.description: [Interactive application security testing|https://www.synopsys.com/glossary/what-is-iast.html] solutions help organizations identify and manage security risks associated with vulnerabilities discovered in running web applications using dynamic testing techniques.
fields.customfield_13513: IAST is used to identify and manage security risks associated with vulnerabilities discovered in running web applications using dynamic testing techniques.

fields.description: Chaos engineering is, at its root, all about stress testing software systems in order to minimize downtime and maximize resiliency. Security chaos engineering takes these principles forward into the domain of security. The central argument of security chaos engineering is that current security practices aren’t fit for purpose.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Security Chaos Engineering to secure applications.

fields.description: Consulting across all disciplines (req analysis, impl, analysis)
fields.customfield_13513: Consulting across all disciplines (req analysis, impl, analysis)

fields.description: Eclipse [Deeplearning4j|https://deeplearning4j.org/] is a deep learning programming library written for Java and the Java virtual machine (JVM) and a computing framework with wide support for deep learning algorithms.
fields.customfield_13513: ML framework for Java. But usually we use Tensorflow today.

fields.description: [H2O Driverless AI|https://www.h2o.ai/products/h2o-driverless-ai/] is an artificial intelligence (AI) platform for automatic machine learning. Driverless AI automates some of the most difficult data science and machine learning workflows such as feature engineering, model validation, model tuning, model selection, and model deployment.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as framework for ML.

fields.description: [Google AutoML|https://cloud.google.com/automl/] is a cloud software suite of Machine Learning tools. It's based on Google's state-of-the-art research in image recognition called Neural Architecture Search (NAS).
fields.customfield_13513: We use it as framework for ML.

fields.description: [Cognitive computing|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_computing] (CC) describes technology platforms that, broadly speaking, are based on the scientific disciplines of artificial intelligence and signal processing. These platforms encompass machine learning, reasoning, natural language processing, speech recognition and vision (object recognition), human–computer interaction, dialog and narrative generation, among other technologies

Anomaly detection problem for time series is usually formulated as finding outlier data points relative to some standard or usual signal . While there are plenty of anomaly types, we'll focus only on the most important ones from a business perspective, such as unexpected spikes, drops, trend changes and level shifts.
fields.customfield_13513: We use ML for Time Series Detection.

fields.description: Data augmentation is a strategy that enables practitioners to significantly increase the diversity of data available for training models, without actually collecting new data. Data augmentation techniques such as cropping, padding, and horizontal flipping are commonly used to train large neural networks.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Data Augmentation for ML to generate more training data.

fields.description: In deep learning, a [convolutional neural network|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolutional_neural_network] (CNN, or ConvNet) is a class of deep neural networks, most commonly applied to analyzing visual imagery. They are also known as shift invariant or space invariant artificial neural networks (SIANN), based on their shared-weights architecture and translation invariance characteristics. They have applications in image and video recognition, recommender systems, image classification, medical image analysis, and natural language processing.
fields.customfield_13513: We use CNNs for classification and extraction.

fields.description: [Quantum computing|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_computing] is the study of a non-classical model of computation. Whereas traditional models of computing such as the Turing machine or Lambda calculus rely on "classical" representations of computational memory, a quantum computation could transform the memory into a quantum superposition of possible classical states. A quantum computer is a device that could perform such computation.
Fosters the creation of open and tailored APM and monitoring solutions. OpenAPM shows which open source Application Performance Management tools are suitable for a stack.
fields.customfield_13513: we use it to choose tools suitable for a stack

fields.description: The [General Data Protection Regulation|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Data_Protection_Regulation] (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR) is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy for all individual citizens of the European Union (EU) and the European Economic Area (EEA). It also addresses the transfer of personal data outside the EU and EEA areas. The GDPR aims primarily to give control to individuals over their personal data and to simplify the regulatory environment for international business by unifying the regulation within the EU. Superseding the Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC, the regulation contains provisions and requirements related to the processing of personal data of individuals (formally called data subjects in the GDPR) inside the EEA, and applies to any enterprise established in the EEA or—regardless of its location and the data subjects' citizenship—that is processing the personal information of data subjects inside the EEA.
fields.customfield_13513: Knowledge of GDPR is necessary in most of our projects.

fields.description: [COBIT stands for Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology|http://www.isaca.org/COBIT]. It is a framework created by the ISACA (Information Systems Audit and Control Association) for IT governance and management. It was designed to be a supportive tool for managers—and allows bridging the crucial gap between technical issues, business risks, and control requirements. COBIT is a thoroughly recognized guideline that can be applied to any organization in any industry. Overall, COBIT ensures quality, control, and reliability of information systems in an organization, which is also the most important aspect of every modern business ([source|https://www.simplilearn.com/what-is-cobit-significance-and-framework-rar309-article]).
fields.customfield_13513: We implement COBIT.

fields.description: Container Application Platform
fields.customfield_13513: OpenShift is used as a family of containerization software. An on-premises platform as a service built around Docker containers orchestrated and managed by Kubernetes on a foundation of Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

fields.description:
Function as a Service (FaaS) is a category of cloud computing services that provides a platform allowing customers to develop, run, and manage application functionalities without minding the complexity of maintaining the infrastructure.

FaaS Lambda is FaaS service of aws.
fields.customfield_13513: FaaS Lambda is part of our repertoire.

fields.description: Containerization involves bundling an application together with all of its related configuration files, libraries and dependencies required for it to run in an efficient and bug-free way across different computing environments. The most popular containerization ecosystems are [Docker|https://www.docker.com/] and [Kubernetes|https://kubernetes.io/].
fields.customfield_13513: We use Containerization to create and deploy applications

fields.description: Polyglot microservices allow developers to pick a programming language of their choice in order to build products in more efficient ways. Industry professionals believe that, when the governance over which programming language to develop in are loosened, there are more opportunities for developer creativity and out-of-the-box problem solving.
fields.customfield_13513: Using polyglot microservices we can choose the suitable technology for the domain and problem.

fields.description: A cloud-computing execution model in which the cloud provider runs the server, and dynamically manages the allocation of machine resources.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it to build modern applications with increased agility and lower total cost of ownership.

fields.description: Cloud Native Patterns (see 12-factor-app)
fields.customfield_13513: Cloud Native Patterns (see 12-factor-app)

fields.description: Task Management Framework to manage task lists - Open Source led by Novatec
fields.customfield_13513: Task Management Framework to manage task lists - Open Source led by Novatec

fields.description: a powerful enterprise architecture (EA) platform that allows collaborative modeling and uses Visio to visualize business
fields.customfield_13513: we use it for planning and executing strategic change

fields.description: [TOGAF|https://www.opengroup.org/togaf] is a framework for enterprise architecture that provides an approach for designing, planning, implementing, and governing an enterprise architecture.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it when working on an enterprise architecture.

fields.description:
IT4IT, an Open Group standard, provides a vendor-neutral, technology-agnostic, and industry-agnostic reference architecture for managing the business of IT, enabling insight for continuous improvement.

IT4IT provides the capabilities for managing the business of IT that will enable IT execution across the entire value chain in a better, faster, cheaper way with less risk.

IT4IT is industry-independent to solve the same problems for everyone.

IT4IT is designed for existing landscapes and accommodates new IT paradigms such as cloud-brokering, DevOps, Bimodal IT, Agile, and Lean IT.

IT4IT complements existing process frameworks and methodologies (e.g., ITIL®, COBIT®, and the TOGAF® standard) by taking a data-focused and solution oriented implementation model perspective, essentially specifying what information is needed and how IT activities can be automated across the entire value chain.
fields.customfield_13513: We use it for specifying the functional components and information model needed to standardize the end-to-end IT value chain.

fields.description:
[Event-driven architecture (EDA)|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Event-driven_architecture] is a software architecture paradigm promoting the production, detection, consumption of, and reaction to events.

This architectural pattern may be applied by the design and implementation of applications and systems that transmit events among loosely coupled software components and services. An event-driven system typically consists of event emitters (or agents), event consumers (or sinks), and event channels. Emitters have the responsibility to detect, gather, and transfer events. An Event Emitter does not know the consumers of the event. Sinks have the responsibility of applying a reaction as soon as an event is presented. The knowledge of the correct distribution of events is exclusively present within the event channel. The physical implementation of event channels can be based on traditional components such as message-oriented middleware or point-to-point communication.
fields.customfield_13513: We use an Event-driven architecture (EDA) where it is appropriate.

fields.description: Story Slicing is an agile method to split up large user stories into smaller pieces. An example for Story Slicing can be found in our [blog|https://www.novatec-gmbh.de/en/blog/story-slicing-the-benefits-of-the-noestimates-approach/].
fields.customfield_13513: We use Story Slicing as an agile method especially together with #NoEstimates

fields.description: A digital workplace (or virtual workplace) is a workplace that is not located in any one physical space. It is usually in a network of several workplaces technologically connected (via a private network or the Internet) without regard to geographic boundaries. Employees are thus able to interact in a Collaborative Working Environment regardless of where they are located. A digital workplace integrates hardware, people, and online processes.
fields.customfield_13513: We use Digital Workplaces in our projects.

fields.description: [Event Storming|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Event_storming] is a workshop-based method to quickly find out what is happening in the domain of a software program. The business process is "stormed out" as a series of domain events which are denoted as orange stickies. It was invented by Alberto Brandolini in the context of domain-driven design (DDD).
fields.customfield_13513: We use Event Storming in our daily work with DDD.

fields.description: [Management 3.0|https://management30.com/] is an ever-changing collection of games, tools, and practices to help any worker to manage the organization. It is a way of looking at work systems and the best known representative of Agile Leadership.
fields.customfield_13513:
We give trainings, we use it internally and we do consulting for Management 3.0
We also own 10% of the shares in the company.

fields.description:
ISO 38500 is an international standard for Corporate governance of information technology published jointly by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). It provides a framework for effective governance of IT to assist those at the highest level of organizations to understand and fulfill their legal, regulatory, and ethical obligations in respect of their organizations’ use of IT. According to ISO 38500 they are six principles for good corporate governance of IT:

- Responsibility
- Strategy
- Acquisition
- Performance
- Conformance
- Human behavior
fields.customfield_13513: We use the ISO 38500 standard for desging the Corporate Governance.
